translated: Ritual Procedures for Reciting the Great Victorious Vajra Buddha's Crown
Translated by the Tripiá¹­aka Master Vajrabodhi of South India, by imperial decree
At that time, the World-Honored One, for the sake of all sentient beings in the Dharma-ending age, manifested five kinds of light.
From the crown, he emitted a fire-like light,
illuminating the evil demons and spirits in the three realms who did not believe in the Buddha's teachings.
At the same time, they were all burned.
VajrapÄá¹‡i Bodhisattva, having seen this sign,
addressed the World-Honored One, saying,
The wisdom fire of the TathÄgata burns all the heavenly demons and spirits who harm sentient beings.
They are all terrified and cannot find peace.
What Dharma do you wish to speak?
I only pray that the TathÄgata will expound it.
At that time, MahÄvairocana Buddha told VajrapÄá¹‡i Bodhisattva, saying,
There is a vidyÄrÄja named the Great Victorious Buddha's Crown Heart Mantra.
Reciting it once fulfills all wishes.
It is the most victorious vidyÄrÄja among the buddhas of the ten directions.
If there is a vajra child
who recites it 50,000 times,
All buddhas, great bodhisattvas, devas, dragons, and celestial maidens,
Together protect day and night, causing one's wishes to be fulfilled.
At that time, the TathÄgata spoke the mantra, saying:ğŸ”½Oá¹ƒ mahÄ-vajra-sekhara hÅ«á¹ƒ trÄá¹ƒ hÅ«á¹ƒ
The two hands form the inner bond, with the forbearance and vow fingers bent like a crown.
This is called the fundamental great mudrÄ.
If, in the time of the final Dharma,
There are sentient beings who always form this mudrÄ and recite the mantra,
All military forces will be unable to harm them.
Water and fire will not burn or float them away.
They will not be bothered by any evil demons or evil ghosts.
The holy assembly of the vajra womb will come and increase their protection, whether they are sitting or lying down.
Next, the method of painting the image is explained.
During the dark lunar mansion, take pure silk or plain silk,
And paint the Great Victorious Bright King.
Wearing the crown of the five buddhas,
Appearing with twelve arms,
Abiding in the wisdom fist mudrÄ,
Holding the mudras of five-pronged vajra, blue lotus, wish-fulfilling jewel, karma, hook, rope, chain, bell, sharp sword, and discus, etc.
Residing on a white lotus flower with a thousand petals.
The body color is like white light.
The entire body is filled with firelight.
In the four corners, draw the four wrathful kings.ğŸ”½In the southeast corner, draw Acala Vajra.
In the southwest corner, draw Hayagriva Vajra.ğŸ”½In the northwest corner, draw Six-footed Vajra.
In the northeast corner, draw Yaksha Vajra.
Draw these four wrathful kings.
Each holding weapons.
Displaying extremely fierce and sharp power.
Next, draw the eight directional celestial kings.
Each surrounded by their retinues with respect.
If there are mantra practitioners who wish to make offerings,
In a clean room or in a mountain forest, in a quiet place,
Burn incense and scatter seasonal flowers.
Recite the mantra 500,000 times.
I and the immeasurable celestial bodhisattvas and vajra deities of the eight buddhas' crowns,
Will manifest our bodies and always serve at your beck and call.
If there are sentient beings who recite and uphold this mantra daily,
in their present life,
they will surpass all celestial beings and humans.
In the future,
their body will be like the Honored One of Universal Illumination.
Those who uphold this mudra and mantra
will be able to accomplish ten koá¹­is of wishes.

I will create ten thousand Vajra Boys
and always abide according to the reciter's wishes.
If one has a compassionate mind, do not hate others.
Contemplate the syllable hÅ«á¹ƒ above the heart.
Abiding in the samÄdhi of the principal deity while walking, standing, sitting, or lying down,
one will accomplish all wishes.
Sentient beings who see this person
will all be delighted and think of him with affection.
This person is like the Honored One of Universal Illumination.
Immeasurable buddhas will always come to protect him and not abandon him.
The mantra practitioner will not give rise to afflictions such as greed, anger, and delusion.
They deeply take refuge in the Three Jewels.
Those who dedicate their roots of goodness to the six realms,
Will surely quickly attain supreme enlightenment.

Make a fist with the four fingers of the right hand,

One round is finished
